unnormalised: Someone asked about the weather in Mumbai, huh? Well, let me tell you, predicting Mumbai's weather is like predicting when your local train will actually arrive – a total gamble! They might tell you it's gonna be sunny on 15/08/2024, but by 15:00 hrs, it's pouring cats and dogs. My advice? Always carry an umbrella, even if the weather app says "0% chance of rain". You'll thank me later.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the monsoon season. From approx. June 1st till... well, whenever it feels like stopping, it's just a non-stop water park. You'll see people wading through knee-deep water, auto-rickshaws floating (sort of), and everyone complaining about how "this is worse than last year!". The IMD might issue a "red alert" for 05/07/2024, but honestly, every day during monsoon feels like a red alert.

unnormalised: So, to sum it up, Mumbai weather? Expect the unexpected. Just assume it’s gonna be humid, probably rainy, and definitely unpredictable. Oh, and check the weather report at, say, 7:00 AM only if you want a good laugh before starting your day. It will likely be wrong by 7:05!
